content:
Diagnosis:	T1N0M0 high grade urothelial carcinoma of bladder

Management:	12 Mar 2024 TURBT - complete resection achieved

Histology:	High grade urothelial carcinoma, T1, no lymphovascular invasion
	PD-L1 CPS 10

Current Situation:	Post-TURBT assessment

[redacted name] attended clinic today following recent TURBT performed by [redacted name]. Histology confirms high-grade T1 disease with no lymphovascular invasion. Recovery from surgery has been uncomplicated with good urinary function. No current haematuria. Performance status is 0.

I have discussed management options including intravesical BCG versus surveillance. Given the high-grade nature of the disease, I have recommended proceeding with induction BCG. [redacted name] understands the treatment schedule and potential side effects. We will arrange BCG induction to commence in 2 weeks time once the bladder has fully healed.

Plan is for BCG induction followed by maintenance schedule. Will arrange follow-up flexible cystoscopy in 3 months. CT urogram to be scheduled prior to next clinic review.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: high grade urothelial carcinoma, no lymphovascular invasion

cancer_timeline.value: Histology confirms high-grade T1 disease with no lymphovascular invasion

status_updates.value: Recently diagnosed high-grade T1 bladder cancer following TURBT. Uncomplicated recovery, proceeding to intravesical BCG therapy.
Plan to commence BCG induction therapy in 2 weeks
CT urogram and follow-up flexible cystoscopy in 3 months
